title: 114_hr5424
content: The Act titled "Investment Advisers Modernization Act of 2016" modernizes requirements for investment advisers. The Investment Advisers Modernization Act of 2016 updates rules for investment advisers, including provisions on assignment of investment advisory contracts. The Investment Advisers Modernization Act of 2016 updates rules for investment advisers, including provisions on assignment of investment advisory contracts. The act states that admission shall be only a minority of the members, partners, shareholders, or other equity owners with a minority interest in the business. It also allows qualified clients to provide consent to assignment at the time of entering, extending, or renewing a contract. Additionally, there is no requirement to provide notification of a change in the membership of a partnership. The Investment Advisers Modernization Act of 2016 updates rules for investment advisers, including provisions on membership of partnership and advertising rules. It amends section 205 of the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 and requires the Commission to amend section 275.206(4)-1 of title 17, Code of Federal Regulations within 90 days. The Investment Advisers Modernization Act of 2016 updates rules for investment advisers, including provisions on advertising. It exempts certain advertisements from specific paragraphs for qualified clients and knowledgeable employees. The Investment Advisers Modernization Act of 2016 updates rules for investment advisers, including provisions on advertising. It exempts certain advertisements for qualified purchasers, knowledgeable employees, and accredited investors. SEC. 3. Removing duplicative burdens and tailoring requirements appropriately. The Commission will amend regulations related to Form PF and the Custody Rule within 90 days of the enactment of the Act. Investment advisers to private funds will only need to report information required by Form PF sections 1a and 1b, unless they are large hedge fund or liquidity fund advisers. The Custody Rule will be amended to expand on IM Guidance Update No. 2013-04 regarding certain privately offered securities. Investment advisers to private funds will only need to report information required by Form PF sections 1a and 1b, unless they are large hedge fund or liquidity fund advisers. The Custody Rule will be amended to expand on IM Guidance Update No. 2013-04 regarding certain privately offered securities. Additionally, the Commission will amend section 275.206(4)-6 of title 17, Code of Federal Regulations, to remove certain requirements for privately offered securities and proxy voting rules. SEC. 4. The Commission is prohibited from extending certain provisions to offerings of securities by private funds or adopting rules that are substantially the same. SEC. 5. The Act does not apply to advisory services provided to registered investment companies. SEC. 6. Any reference to a regulation in this Act includes any successor regulation. SEC. 7. Definitions. SEC. 7. DEFINITIONS. The term "public security" refers to securities issued by issuers required to submit reports under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 or listed on foreign exchanges. Terms defined in the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 have the same meanings.
